comment:
McQuaker’s Oatmeal stout
(5 gallons/19 L, all-grain)
OG = 1.055 (13.5 °P)
FG = 1.016 (4.1 °P)
IBU = 28  SRM = 35  ABV = 5.1%
Ingredients
8.5 lb. (3.85 kg) Thomas Fawcett & Sons Maris Otter pale ale malt
(or similar English pale ale malt)
14.1 oz. (400 g) Great Western flaked oats 1 °L

8.5 lb. (3.85 kg) Thomas Fawcett & Sons Maris Otter pale ale malt
(or similar English pale ale malt)
14.1 oz. (400 g) Great Western flaked oats 1 °L
10.6 oz. (300 g) Briess Victory® malt 28 °L 10.6 oz. (300 g) Thomas Fawcett & Sons chocolate malt 350 °L
7.1 oz. (200 g) Thomas Fawcett & Sons roasted barley 500 °L 7.1 oz. (200 g) Thomas Fawcett & Sons crystal malt 85 °L
7.5 AAU Kent Goldings pellet hops (60 min.) (1.5 oz./42 g at 5% alpha acids) White Labs WLP002 (English Ale) or Wyeast 1968 (London ESB) yeast

73% MO
7% oats
5% choc
5%  vic
3%  roasted
3%  crystal
toast oats at 300 until they begin to slightly color up and nutty aroma, 1.5 qts per lb, 60 min boil,
actual v 1, i changed the lovibond and AA in the recipe and to match ingrediants, UK crystal was 60 not 80, roast bar was 525, choc was 400, victory was 28, 2 vials of 005, 2 of 023 burton ale.
base was pale ale malt briess, not maris, 1.5 qts per lb, 163 strike, mash 157, ended up overnight mash, 139, mashout to 178, 1064 og, 10 gallons
1010 for the burton (yeast raft) 1011 for the british,

British is way better than burton, burton is a biy too fruity and brings out the anise flavor, british is so nice and creamy and roasy. Adding 1 oz vanilla extract, 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon, 1/2 teaspoon ginger, 1/4 teaspoon nutmeg into a 3ish gallons
